speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'm off to get our lunch.  Any special requests?

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, no, no, no, anything you pick you will be fine.

speaker: Daphne
text: Okay, then.  Back in a bit.

speaker: Sherry
text: She is such a doll.  You are such a doll!

speaker: Sherry
text: I thought she'd never leave!

speaker: Martin
text: I know.  It's nice to have some time alone finally.

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, isn't it?

speaker: Martin
text: Come here, you. _Martin and Sherry start kissing passionately.  Then Eddie runs in and starts licking Sherry's face._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, get your own.  Now, come on now, get away, come on. Come with me, come on, Eddie. [_gets up_] Come on.

speaker: Martin
text: There you go.  Seat's already up for you.  It's happy hour! [_shuts door_] Where were we?

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, come here, you little devil, you. _Martin and Sherry start kissing again but Daphne enters with Niles and Frasier carrying food bags._

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, look who was just coming home with take-out from the gourmet shop.

speaker: Sherry
text: Boys, hi.  Don't you look handsome in your best bib and tucker.  Come and give Aunt Sherry a great big kiss!

speaker: Niles
text: Perhaps just a friendly wave from across the room.

speaker: Sherry
text: Niles, you are so shy.  Thank God your big brother isn't. Now come on, Fras, plant one on me. [_he reluctantly does_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_screws his face_] Has Eddie been licking you?

speaker: Sherry
text: Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, I thought your perfume had a hint of sausage in it.

speaker: Sherry
text: So, you two've been shopping?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, antiquing actually.  I just found the most exquisite Japanese door knocker, it's said to bring peace and tranquility to any home it adorns.

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, I haven't seen any decent oriental knocker since "Emperor Charles's Shanghai revue!"

speaker: Martin
text: [_laughs like mad_] Isn't she great?  She is as funny as she is classy!

speaker: Niles
text: No argument there!  Oh, by the way, if you want someone to install that for you, I can put you in touch with my ex- houseman, Guy. [_sounds like Ge_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Guy?

speaker: Niles
text: No, [_same pronunciation_] Guy!

speaker: Frasier
text: Guy?

speaker: Niles
text: No, back of the throat, [_same pronunciation_] Guy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, what's the difference?!  Also, heavens, I can install a simple door knocker on my own. [_laughs_] _Frasier opens the door and puts the knocker up to the door. He stares at it._

speaker: Martin
text: You probably need a screwdriver.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's exactly what I was about to get.

speaker: Martin
text: It's in the tool drawer.

speaker: Martin
text: The drawer under that big tea server thing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, that is a Byelorussian samovar!  My God, how long have you lived here?!

speaker: Daphne
text: Here we are.  Lunch is ready.

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, actually, hon, I just remembered I've got an errand I gotta run before I get to work.  Goodbye, Niles. [_goes to him_] Don't worry, I'm not going to kiss you, I know it embarrasses you.  Wait, come here, you've got some schmutz on your cheek.

speaker: Sherry
text: My mistake, it's a mole, you might want to have that checked.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I think now I'll just play it safe and have it removed. [_wipes off Sherry's spit_] _Frasier enters with the screwdriver and notices one of his ornaments on his display shelf._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Daphne, you know, apparently this morning when you were dusting, you forgot this object does not face front but rather askew. [_turns it_]

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm so sorry, Dr. Crane, I should never have tried to do it without that diagram you drew me.

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, Frasier, now that I know you like antiques, I've got a little present at home for you.  It's a lamp, shaped like two frogs kissing and when you turn it on, their hearts glow.  When would you like me to bring it by?

speaker: Niles
text: Preferably when I'm here.

speaker: Sherry
text: I'll bring it with me tomorrow.  Bye-bye. [_exits with Martin_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, would you bring me the hammer?

speaker: Daphne
text: I thought you just needed a screwdriver for your door knocker.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I do, I just want to be prepared for when that froggy lamp gets here.

speaker: Sherry
text: I'll see you later, honey, I'll call you.

speaker: Martin
text: Okay, bye. _Frasier starts to screw on his knocker as the doors open.  An old, frosty woman is standing in the elevator as Sherry steps on._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, hi there, Mrs. Langer.

speaker: Langer
text: Ms!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, right, Ms...

speaker: Martin
text: Ms...erable cow! [_laughs and enters apartment_] Niles, tonight's your opera night, isn't it?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  Why?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I was just wondering.  You know, I'd love to cook a nice romantic dinner for Sherry but I can't do it at her place because I'm allergic to her cats and there is no privacy around here.

speaker: Niles
text: Say no more, Dad.  My bachelor pad is the perfect place to entertain a young lady.  Just remember, always use coasters, no snacking in the carpeted areas and close the art books after viewing so you don't crease the spine!

speaker: Frasier
text: I think they have the same rules at the "Playboy Mansion."

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it's on, that's fast.  Huh, that's not so hard.  You know, tomorrow morning I think I may just have to attack that leaking sink in the powder room. [_closes door_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, sorry, I thought that was a joke.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah!  The inaugural knock. _Frasier opens the door to find a note attached to the knocker. He takes it._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, what's this? [_reads_] "Your unauthorised door knocker violates the condo by-laws regarding hallway decoration. Remove it immediately."

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, that's one of Mrs. Langer's no-no slips.  I can't stand that woman.  Just because she's president of the condo board she acts like this building's her kingdom.  Everything has to be done exactly the way she likes it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, Daphne, nobody hates a bossy fussbudget more than I do but... Daphne, askew, askew! [_turns another objet d'art_] But, rules are there for reason.  I was obviously at fault for not getting approval before I hung it up there.

speaker: Niles
text: I did notice a sign in the lobby about some condo board meeting tonight if you want to present your case.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, perfect.  We live in a democratic system and I will work within it.  I'm sure I can persuade them with my charm and eloquence.

speaker: Daphne
text: I don't know, those people can be very difficult.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, pish-tosh!  It's not as though I'll be addressing the Supreme Court, I'll simply be talking to the board!

speaker: Martin
text: [_aside_] Well, they will be by the time he gets though! _Frasier exits.  FADE OUT  Scene Two - Condo Board Meeting. A crowd of tenants is gathered listening to Ms. Langer.  Langer is sat at the front table with two other members of the board.  As Langer speaks, Frasier enters cautiously at the back and sits next to Molly, a resident in a wheelchair._

speaker: Langer
text: After careful consideration of the bids from a number of gardeners, we have decided to go with Jordan landscaping.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Molly_] Excuse me, I'm not too late, am I?  I was hoping to make a statement.

speaker: Molly
text: Me too.  They will be getting to new business soon, fortunately.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good, good.  I have a matter of some importance.

speaker: Molly
text: Oh, well then you should go before me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, thank you.  Why are you here?

speaker: Molly
text: I'm going to ask them to make the ramp outside the building less steep, so I don't keep rolling into traffic.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_guilty_] Oh, well, er, perhaps you should go first.

speaker: Langer
text: Is that Frasier Crane talking while I'm talking?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yes, I'm sorry, Ms. Langer.  I was just inquiring as to whether I was too late to raise some new business.

speaker: Langer
text: Well, we were just about to get to that.  Why don't you go ahead?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Molly_] I'll be quick. [_stands and speaks_] Ah, earlier today, I installed a new door knocker without your permission.  Now, I'd like to say in my defense that my over- eagerness was not out of disrespect but rather enthusiasum for the door knocker, which I'm sure you will agree is really quite beautiful. [_hands the board members a picture_] I understand the rule exists to prohibit people from putting eyesores in public places, but I ask you, should it apply to something as beautiful as this? [_hands some pictures out to audience_] Here, if you will please.  Something, which only serves to elevate our spirits.  Let's just say somebody passes by my door, sees the knocker and suddenly feels just a little bit better without even knowing why.  That same person passes a perfect stranger and smiles - who in turn... reaches down and picks up, perhaps, a piece of trash; plants a garden, volunteers at a soup kitchen?  Like little ripples on a still pond, the happiness spreads.  What I'm asking to do, think of this not simply as an ornament but rather an opportunity, dare I say it, of knocking on the door of a new, more civilised world. [_collects pictures_] Thank you.

speaker: Langer
text: Allow us just a moment.

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course.

speaker: Langer
text: Request denied!  You must remove the knocker within twenty- four hours, despite the consequences to world peace.

speaker: Frasier
text: I appreciate your...

speaker: Langer
text: Are you still talking?  Your request is denied!  Sit down!

speaker: Frasier
text: But there has been no discussion, it hasn't even been opened up to the floor.

speaker: Langer
text: I will entertain suggestions from the floor if anyone has any idea how to shut this man up!

speaker: Frasier
text: Forget it!  I came down here expecting a fair hearing in the democratic tradition, but here you are: a tyrant more concerned with the exercise of power than with justice! Well, I will leave now taking solace in the certain knowledge that in time, you, Ms. Langer, will join all tyrants on the ash-heap of history! _Frasier exits amid great applause from the audience.  A second later, Frasier reenters, embarrassed because he's left his briefcase behind._

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm not here. _He picks up his briefcase and goes to the door.  However, all his papers spill out._

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I'll just get those later. **DEEP EAR, NOSE AND THROAT** _Scene Three - Elliot Bay Towers Parking Lot. Frasier pulls his car into his space and gets out.  He locks the door. The lot is very dark as he heads to the stairs.  However a car pulls up in front of him, blinding him with the headlights.  An unknown man gets out of his car and stands in front of the headlights so Frasier can't see him._

speaker: Man
text: Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  Who's there?

speaker: Man
text: A friend. [_Frasier steps forward_] Ah, keep your distance.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why can't I see you?

speaker: Man
text: That's not important right now.  What's important is that you were not afraid to go up against Ms. Langer last night.

speaker: Frasier
text: Without much success.

speaker: Man
text: More than you know.  Those people in the building are afraid of her.  There is a group of us who fight her though, a small- but-determined band of resistors.  You know the doormat by the service elevator? [_Frasier nods_] We did that!

speaker: Frasier
text: It's very nice.

speaker: Man
text: We would like you to be our candidate to go up against her in the upcoming elections.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm very flattered, but you see...

speaker: Man
text: You are our only chance, Dr. Crane, and she must be defeated. [_carried away_] She is evil!  Heckles in 1704 was two days late with his condo fee and she lowered the water pressure in his shower.  Eventually he died.

speaker: Frasier
text: Of bad water pressure?

speaker: Man
text: No, I think it was a hunting accident.  But he spent his last months on this earth unable to get all the conditioner out of his hair.  Only you posses the charisma and courage to defeat her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that may be, but, er...

speaker: Man
text: I am not asking you to decide right now.  I just want you to say you'll think about it.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, but why can't I see who you are?

speaker: Man
text: Because I'm remodeling my bathroom!  If she found out I was talking to you, she would never approve my bidet.  Just think of me as "Mr. X"! _"Mr. X" gets in his car and drives away.  Frasier notices the plates on the car that read "DRDORF"._

speaker: Frasier
text: That would work better without the vanity plates, Dr. Dorfman! _End of Act One.  Act Two.  Scene One - Frasier's Apartment Building. It is just after Frasier's surprise meeting.  Frasier is at the elevator and presses to go up, but Niles arrives._

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, wait.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hello, Niles. [_opens doors for him_] You know, Niles, the most extraordinary thing just happened to me down at the garage.

speaker: Niles
text: Excuse me... is Dad home now?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, as far as I know.

speaker: Niles
text: I was afraid of that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why?  Is something wrong?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, last night I invited Dad to use my apartment for a quiet, romantic dinner with Sherry while I attended "La Traviata."  Well, the production was just dreadful.  In "Opoir Selor Oui," the soprano couldn't hit the E flat above high C to save her life!  I was so fed up I stormed out, drove home, entered my apartment and when I saw what Dad and Sherry were doing there, I hit the note myself!

speaker: Frasier
text: You mean they were...

speaker: Niles
text: They were!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh!  What did you do?

speaker: Niles
text: Pulled up a chaise lounge and took out my opera glasses, what do you think I did?  I slammed the door and ran away. I've never been so embarrassed.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Niles, you simply have to diffuse the entire subject with simple, adult conversation.  I don't want to re-create what happened to Maris and me after the cabin incident when I walked in on her taking a shower.  Oh God, months of avoidance and awkwardness.

speaker: Niles
text: [_shocked_] Excuse me?  You saw my Maris completely naked?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, don't fret, Niles, it was really nothing more than a fleeting glance in a very steamy bathroom.  More like glimpsing a birch sapling through a thick fog.

speaker: Niles
text: Life is so unfair!  You get a vision of my Maris, I get a big eyefull of Dad!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'd say we hit about the same level on the "Yikes!" meter! _The elevator stops and the doors open revealing Roz waiting outside Frasier's apartment._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Roz, you're here.

speaker: Roz
text: Is that your idea of an apology for making me work on a Saturday and then getting here late?!

speaker: Frasier
text: I was detained.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, the most extraordinary thing happened.  I was down at the parking garage, when suddenly I was blinded by a set of headlights.  A mysterious man crept from the shadows and told me I should run for condo board president.

speaker: Roz
text: You've been at your wine club, haven't you?!

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  This really happened.

speaker: Niles
text: Surely you're not actually thinking of running?  You've never held an elected office in your life.

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you forgetting I served two terms back in high school as grand panem tandrum of the vocabulary club!

speaker: Roz
text: Listen, Frasier, this job is a nightmare.  Trust me, I know. Like if somebody wants a garbage disposal, they'll bug you day and night, they'll leave kitchen scraps in your mailbox until they get what they want.

speaker: Frasier
text: Have you served on a condo board?

speaker: Roz
text: No, but I have a brand new garbage disposal.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, all. [_they greet her_]

speaker: Niles
text: Let me help you with those. [_he does_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Thanks.  I've had to lug these things five blocks.  This morning, Mrs. Langer gave me one of those no-no slips for parking in the same vacant space I've been using for years.

speaker: Frasier
text: God, I'm sorry, Daphne, I'm afraid this is my fault.  Ms. Langer's simply retaliated against me.  You see, last night I rather humiliated her in a dazzling display of rhetoric!

speaker: Daphne
text: I heard you spilled your briefcase all over the floor.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, this building has a grapevine Ernest & Julio Gallo would envy!  You know, perhaps I should run against Ms. Langer.  God knows, she's ripe for a good comeuppance!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I know exactly what you mean, Dr. Crane.  I was standing behind her in the elevator the other day, looking at the back of her head and I thought, you know, several stout whacks with a tire iron and this building would be a much happier place! I'll just get these bags off to the kitchen.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, this Langer woman sounds as if she wields considerable power.  What if you run against her and lose?

speaker: Roz
text: I'm with Niles, let somebody else do it.

speaker: Frasier
text: What an appalling expression of apathy.  What kind of a world do you think this would be if everyone thought the way you two do? [_Niles exits to the kitchen to help Daphne_]

speaker: Roz
text: Everyone does think the way we do.

speaker: Frasier
text: And look at the kind of world it is!  Corruption in high places, illiterates unconcerned with the real issues because they are too consumed with the same selfish pleasures!

speaker: Niles
text: [_enters with an eclair_] Is this eclair spoken for?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's mine, put it back! [_he does_] Where will this all lead? The point is, if you're not willing to get involved then you have no right to grumble when things don't go your way.

speaker: Martin
text: Look at this.  I've got two slips for not taking Eddie in the freight elevator.  It's ridiculous, everybody uses the main elevator.  Mrs. Tortwurst has her dog, Fluffy, in there all the time.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_takes slip_] Oh, that's it, I am running for condo board president.  The time comes in every man's life when he must meet face to face with a challenge, rather than skitter away like a coward.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm proud of you son, that's a way a Crane talks! _Niles then enters from the kitchen and meets Martin.  They both start mumbling at each other, completely nervous.  Martin runs in the kitchen as Niles runs quickly out the door.  Roz looks at Frasier in confusion.  FADE TO:_ **WHAT WE HAVE HERE IS A FAILURE TO COMMUNICATE** _Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. The following day, Daphne is sat reading "Seattle Magazine" in Martin's chair._

speaker: Daphne
text: Okay, Eddie, now. _Eddie is stood on the coffee table.  He has a cloth in his mouth and walks back and forth along the table "cleaning" it.  Frasier enters and stares._

speaker: Daphne
text: Good boy, Eddie.  Now, go make dinner.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's just a little joke Eddie and I have been working on.

speaker: Frasier
text: Too bad, it explains so much. [_looks at a no-no slip on the side_] What is this?  Another one?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, yes, it seems your father got it last night.  I guess he's just refusing to take Eddie in the freight elevator. Of course, all of that will be different once you're elected.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but we don't want to jinx it, Daphne.  I must say, I think my chances are very good after this epistle I found this morning on my windshield.  It's from the Resistance!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_reads_] "Dear Dr. Crane, we have polled the building.  The election is yours, good work.  Signed, Anonymous."  But wouldn't this be more anonymous if it didn't say, "from the desk of Dr. William M. Dorfman"?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, now you see why they need me.  With this lead aside, I still wish I had a punchier opening for this speech I wrote this morning.  Well, I'm running out of time. Unless,  yes... I think Ms. Langer may have given me the very ammunition I need for my opening salvo.  We'll just see how the voters feel about a woman who tries to persecute a disabled ex-policeman and his loyal old dog.

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, it will be nice to live a building where anyone can hang whatever they damn well please on their door!

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course! [_then_] Well, pending my approval.

speaker: Martin
text: Is he gone?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, yes.  You're not avoiding him, are you?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, yeah, kind of.  I mean, it's pretty embarrassing about getting caught last night in that hot tub and then the whole building's talking about it.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, what happened?

speaker: Martin
text: You haven't heard?

speaker: Daphne
text: No.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh!  Well... never mind!

speaker: Daphne
text: No, no, no, no, what?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, after dinner last night my hip was getting kinda stiff so I went down to the hot tub.  Well, you know how it is when you kick up the jets and your trunks fill up like a hot air balloon.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, but go on.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, there was nobody about so I just slipped out of them and tossed them on the deck.

speaker: Daphne
text: You mean you were...?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, just floatin' free.  So, I was sitting there minding my own business, you know, and letting the bubbles do their work and suddenly old lady Langer shows up.  She sees my trunks and she writes me out a no-no slip right there and then.

speaker: Daphne
text: You mean the no-no slip was for being naked in the hot tub?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I told Dr. Crane it was because you took Eddie in the elevator.  Oh, dear, I've got to get down to that condo meeting.

speaker: Martin
text: Why?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I don't know what's going on down there but suddenly I have a very queasy feeling!

speaker: Martin
text: Just what Ms. Langer said when she tossed me my trunks. _Scene Three - Condo Board Meeting. The building is gathered, including Frasier, as Langer finishes her speech._

speaker: Langer
text: So, you can vote for me - a person who has worked this past year to keep this building running smoothly - or you can turn the building over to a man who can scarcely keep his own family under control.  Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_stands_] Hello, condo owners.  I'm sorry my opponent has chosen to be vindictive about my family, but that is merely characteristic of her behaviour during her entire term in office.  How else would one explain this? [_brings out no-no slip_] This citation my father received last night is a perfect example of the prejudice that this woman is capable of.

speaker: Langer
text: We are all aware of your father's behaviour last night. I'm surprised you're not too afraid to bring it up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ashamed?  Not at all!  I defend his behaviour!  So he had his little friend out where he shouldn't be.  So what?  He's been doing it for years!

speaker: Langer
text: You approve of his behaviour?

speaker: Frasier
text: Approve?  I applaud it!  Have you no compassion?  My father is getting older, hasn't many pleasures left in life.  I can't tell you the hours of joy that that little guy has brought him!  And not just him.  Who among us can't help but break into a smile upon seeing the little fella?  Oh, I know, you know, sometimes it is irksome when his little Eddie appears  at any inopportune moments, but...

speaker: Langer
text: He's named it Eddie?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, "Eddie"'s, of course, not a name I might have chose. I might have gone with something a bit more - oh, I don't know, whimsical like, er, oh... Puck!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, the clodsom sprite from Shakespeare's "A Midsummer Night's Dream."  Don't look so shocked!  Whom does it really harm if he unleashes Eddie once in a while?  Come on, it's not as though he's alone in this beheviour.  Mrs. Tortwurst, I've seen you do the same thing many times with your Fluffy. [_she is shocked_] You know, if you ask me, not only is this behaviour harmless, it's laudable.  Why, you should see the looks on the faces of the schoolchildren when he takes Eddie out to the playground. _Daphne enters amid all this confusion and whispers sharply in Frasier's ear.  Frasier takes some time to sink in the information._

speaker: Frasier
text: On the other hand... we all need rules. [_turns to Daphne_] Go!  Go!  Go!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, and sorry about the knocker. _Frasier exits, leaving everyone confused.  End of Act Two._
